website_summaries.verdict: For babies who are just learning to stand and walk (or those who are about to), this is an interactive toy that will hold their attention.
pros: This table goes from a floor toy to a table for ages 6 to 36 months, so they can play with it on the floor when crawling and as a table once they can stand
Features 6 different interactive learning stations, including a clock, play phone, book with pages that teach letters and shapes, and piano keys
cons: When used as a table, it can be a bit wobbly or slide on floors, so putting this on a carpet or rug is best

customer_reviews.title: Learning to stand and be active.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this activity table. It has been helping her to learn to stand. It does slide easily on some surfaces. I keep it setup on top of an activity playmat.
customer_reviews.author: M.P.

customer_reviews.title: My lil munchkin loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my one year old who had just started walking and it’s perfect for her. It’s sturdy enough to support her when she pulls herself up... entertaining enough to keep her attention... definitely something I would recommend... her favorite is the phone, it rings when you pick it up and to be clear the table rings not the actual hand held phone.
customer_reviews.author: Angelie1216

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy for All toddlers striating to stand
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I bought one for my daughter when she had just started standing up. She would walk around it pressing buttons. It helped her stay on her feet a bit longer. Batteries have lasted for 6 months now. We also have the instrument version of this that makes different sounds. This one is more ABC and numbers. She enjoys both.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Her favorite features are the phone and flip book
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this, she learned how to first stand with it. Her favorite features are the phone and flip book. The negatives are it's very light weight so you have to hold it for newly standing babies to lean on, or put it in a corner where it can't go anywhere. Also, there are SO many different sounds and the buttons interrupt what's already playing so after awhile its just a lot of random sounds and can get annoying and overstimulating pretty quickly, like many electronics can.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution with climbers and babes new to standing
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it, but...I wish it were a little sturdier. My daughter just recently started climbing and standing while holding onto furniture. It’s not great for that. I need to stay by her and support the table while she plays so it doesn’t move. Once she gets a little better on her feet I’m sure it’ll be great, but right now while she’s learning and getting stronger, it’s not the best.
customer_reviews.author: KrissyP

customer_reviews.title: Our 7 month olds loves this. I wish it ...
customer_reviews.text: Our 7 month olds loves this. I wish it was a little more stable because it has fallen over on her a few times from the table setup when she tries to stand. However, she has gotten to where if she doesnt use it as much for pulling herself up and does more of the work herself it wont tip. It is just too top heavy. But not heavy enough to hurt a baby I would think, she doesnt seem to be that bothered when it tips.
customer_reviews.author: Troper

customer_reviews.title: A little Short and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: A lot shorter than I was expecting, and the legs are a little wobbly, and the unit pushes across the floor VERY easily. My 8 month old is pulling to stand, and she leans on it which sends it sliding across the floor on carpet and tile. The buttons keep her entertained, and we put it on the bed or floor without the legs to keep her happy.
customer_reviews.author: Selena

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our daughter for Christmas She gets bored with it quick and doesn’t play with it and the phone gets lost all the time as it’s not attached
customer_reviews.author: Jswife4life

customer_reviews.title: Great stand to learn toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great learn to stand toy. The toy aspect is super fun and has 6 different things to play with, and they are super cute! It’s the perfect height for a beginner pull to stand up kiddo. It could be sturdier but it’s fine! Great toy!!
customer_reviews.author: Brea Frickle

customer_reviews.title: Safety hazard
customer_reviews.text: This is not sturdy enough for a 6 month old, my daughter has tipped this over and she fell with it on top of her. Also she gets her fingers pinched on the book holding it down hard enough to leave marks. I really love it other then those things.
customer_reviews.author: OscarA

customer_reviews.title: Not that sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have done more research and gotten a sturdier activity table. My 8 month old can very easily knock this over. The book toy on it has a hard plastic page that my daughter pinched her finger on and whenever she stands by this toy with the legs on she easily moves it around and has knocked it over. There are no grippers on the feet so on my carpet it slides all over, and it's prob worse without carpet. I'd suggest doing some more research and get a table that is heavier and sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Sound doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to leave a good review but I gave as a gift for my friend’s daughter’s first birthday and the lights work but no sound. Changed the batteries and still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbirdsings

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: At first i thought this was a cute learning table age appropriate but 2 of the songs stopped playing, everything else works fine. Not sturdy at all it slides too much even on carpet. If my daughter was any heavier she'd prob fall with it. Too flimsy with those thin plastic legs. Other than that its cute for a couple months. Save your money and get something better.
customer_reviews.author: A.R.

customer_reviews.title: the best sit to stand table
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite sit to stand table. My neice loves all that it has to offer. Multiple songs, several activities on it. She plays with this the most out of all her toys! Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Taleen kouyoumdjian

customer_reviews.title: Neat Educational Table/Very Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! I love it! I actually bought this for my 1 year old for Christmas! She ended up seeing it before I got a chance to gift wrap it and she fell in love!
customer_reviews.author: Oprah A

customer_reviews.title: Learning table
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can use this as a table or pull the top off and have it set on the floor. My daughter absolutely loves the little phone that comes with it. She plays with the phone more than she does with the actual toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: very neato table
customer_reviews.text: my one year old loves this table and the fact u can remove the legs and younger babies can use it on the floor
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Gray

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loved it but toy had to be replaced, and replacement arrived immediately
customer_reviews.text: 1 year old loved it, but quit working after a week. But was immediately replaced with a new one - no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Farfal

customer_reviews.title: My kid likes it and it's easy to play with for a 7 month old
customer_reviews.text: My kid likes it and it's easy to play with for a 7 month old, but it doesn't seem to turn off. When trying to put away while kids are asleep it will play for a long time with only a slight bump, very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Fun Time
customer_reviews.text: Every time my toddler grandchildren come to visit, they enjoy playing with this toy. The fun sounds and music make them laugh and clap.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great but song is sung wrong
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t bad for the price. It is sturdy as it won’t fall over but does slid on hard food. You would want a mat or rug under it to help it from moving. Also the ABC’s are messed up in two spots other than that it works great. My little loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Destany Dean

customer_reviews.title: This is not the same size
customer_reviews.text: very unhappy - considering the price i paid for a toy the size of a small gift box .
customer_reviews.author: bbrilee

customer_reviews.title: 1yo Approved
customer_reviews.text: My 1yo daughter loves this table. She wants to stand all the time, so this was perfect for her! Tons of different things to keep her entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Wells

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: Moves a little easy. Had to put it in a corner so it didn't fall over but my daughter absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Wiltshire

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this for my daughter's 1st birthday, and she ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my daughter's 1st birthday, and she loves it. I thought it would have been a little taller it's her size in height when she kneels, but my baby likes it so no complaints! It is very cute, has music, ABC's, a little phone enough to distract her!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hrrera

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My niece learned how to stand in no time with this toy! Great for stimulation and play
customer_reviews.author: Patrizia Tierno

customer_reviews.title: Easy to ass
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old loves this and was just learning to stand up holding on to things while standing. This toy gave her the ability gain some strength while having fun
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves this toy.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this thing. She's been playing with it since she was about 9 months. She's 15 months now. Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica G

customer_reviews.title: Constantly tips over
customer_reviews.text: This thing is constantly tipping over onto my baby. The legs aren't wide enough at the bottom to keep it stable. Dont waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy. I love vtech toys period. I do think their a little pricey but if my babies love them i love them. Easy to put together and easy to take apart to put up or move around the house. She loses that little phone all the time but its ok. I actually need to order for her twin brother (for a boy)
customer_reviews.author: ravonda foreman

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for baby to toddler
customer_reviews.text: I got this for Christmas for my 10 month old niece. She will love playing with all the different learning tools on it. It will keep her occupied and learn at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy !
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 1 year old and she loves it , she dances with the music and loves the phone she can take out and play with I really recommend kept her busy for hoursss!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Great learn to stand toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for baby to learn to stand with. My daughter loves the phone feature. Easy to assemble, legs just snap on. High quality product.
customer_reviews.author: JILL

customer_reviews.title: purchased as gift
customer_reviews.text: purchased this as a gift for my 6 month old niece for christmas. looks as pictured, cute, works. no complaints i recommend
customer_reviews.author: amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: Very wobbly with cheap legs
customer_reviews.text: Giving 2 stars for the fact that when it’s in sit mode (legs removed) it’s awesome for my 12 month old. To stand, the legs are wobbly, it’s very cheaply made, it slides across the floor so it is not suitable for a child learning to stand, rather it’s for a child who is standing already.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime L

customer_reviews.title: Book flap is questionable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves to play with this but the book flap keeps catching her fingers and pressing on them a bit. It causes some discomfort but nothing major by far. We are deciding if we should remove that part or have it be a learning process to help her improve her motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I could have bought my 8 month old
customer_reviews.text: I love that it automatically turns itself off after a period of non-use. It's sturdy enough for my child to pull themselves up to standing with. Lots of interactive options, music, sounds, and lights. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: JE

customer_reviews.title: she was 8months old at the time and loved it, it was the perfect height for her ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grand baby for Xmas, she was 8months old at the time and loved it, it was the perfect height for her to practice standing, however she doesn’t show much interest in it now at 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: JANET D

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this activity table!! This table got her supported standing at 6 months old!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amber Osgood

customer_reviews.title: The worst thing we ever bought for our kid
customer_reviews.text: The worst thing we ever bought for our kid. Super annoying sounds and cartoon voices that just play even if the child isn't touching it. Will not support the weight of our 18 pound nine month old who is trying to learn to pull herself up on things. Just shoddy in general.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 10 months old and loves her sit to stand!! Especially the phone lol the sturdiness isn’t designed that well but we still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Lights and noises!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old granddaughter plays with it all the time. She walks around it holding on and pushing all the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Luvbooks

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this table, we also have the matching walker like it. Great quality toys.
customer_reviews.author: Tandi

customer_reviews.title: A++ fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Alittle cheap looking but my daughter enjoys it so I say well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fun, durable baby toy.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this product ❤️ It's great for any baby from sitting to almost standing age. It's highly durable and it's not too loud. It's the perfect toy to keep her interested in standing. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cute basic standing table. My daughter enjoys it, she likes all the sound and lights.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Cute little table
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy!! It’s the perfect height and sturdy enough for her to lean on, because she’s still learning how to move around!! The ONLY thing I don’t like about this toy is the phone it comes off so easy I wish it had a little string attached!
customer_reviews.author: ERIN TERRY

customer_reviews.title: Makes the little one happy!
customer_reviews.text: Love the colors and it is a great toy. Good quality and I like that it can be used at different stages (legs vs no legs).
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Cute concept, but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: I loved the different activities this table had, but I was not pleased with how wobbly it was. My 1 year old can hardly touch it without it sliding across the room. Wish I would have paid attention to this prior to buying.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Davis

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this she is 7 months and loves pulling up on it playing with the toys
customer_reviews.author: T blanch

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great for small kids learning to stand an keeps them very entertained great product
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: It's good, with a slight drawback
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm glad we bought this for our daughter. Only complaint is it is very light, light enough my daughter can use it as a walker at 6 months old. 🤦 doesn't have good grip on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mile stone.
customer_reviews.text: Although my daughter is tall this sit to stand table has aided her in standing and given her the confidence to walk. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ebony Ashley McCleod

customer_reviews.title: Portable, fun, engaging, and builds development
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy! It has promoted her standing and exploring. It has enough buttons, sounds, and lights to keep her engaged for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Shaler

customer_reviews.title: Table
customer_reviews.text: LO ones it, helps her stand and keeps her entertained. Songs are super catchy
customer_reviews.author: Shanea

customer_reviews.title: We enjoy it; we just wish it was a little ...
customer_reviews.text: We enjoy it; we just wish it was a little more sturdy as my daughter can easily lift the table and tip it over.
customer_reviews.author: Teri N

customer_reviews.title: The toy is very helpful for learning at that age .
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter love so much her toy , she is very excited when she plays. And I love it too because she’s been learning, she’s only 18 months old. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Slides all over
customer_reviews.text: Good product, my daughter loves it! However, wish there were sticky pads on the bottom of the legs. It slides all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: kmarten

customer_reviews.title: I love it and my 11year old daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: I love it and my 11year old daughter loves it. It keeps her occupied learning numbers and hearing music and learn to stand more on her own. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: marsy

customer_reviews.title: Baby toy
customer_reviews.text: 1st bday gift for my great niece. She loved it.

customer_reviews.title: Slides on CARPET
customer_reviews.text: it slides on the carpet !!!! So I have to post it against the wall ugh . Not sturdy at all

customer_reviews.title: Best learning tool very entertaining
customer_reviews.text: My little girl loves it.. Got it for her for Christmas she plays with it everyday. Perfect learning toy for little ones.

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loves it it’s teaching her to stand. She’s 7 months but she loves all the sounds as well👍👍

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy. It was easily the best Christmas gift she got!

customer_reviews.title: V tech is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for the awesome product... my daughter likes her new toy.

customer_reviews.title: Was it worth buying?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 month old daughter and she loves it so do I, thank you Amazon for this product.

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Good quality granddaughter loves it! Does a lot of things

product_meta.title: VTech Sit-To-Stand Learn & Discover Table, Pink
product_meta.description: The Sit-to-Stand Learn and Discover Table grows with your child, transforming from a floor toy into a two-way learning table. Your child can grow and develop using the interactive electric panel with six learning stations. Your baby will love pretending to talk on the phone, pressing the light-up piano keys, playing with the interactive book and more. Fun sound effects and light patterns reward your child’s curiosity and encourage discovery. Thirteen playful sing-along songs and melodies add to the fun. The Learn and Discover Table introduces letters, numbers, shapes, colors, greetings and time concepts. Have fun with an activity table that grows with your child! Requires 2 AA batteries (included). Baby activity table is intended for infants ages 6 months to 3 years.
feature_bullets: The Sit-to-Stand Learn and Discover Table grows with your child, transforming from a floor toy into a two-way learning table
Your child can grow and develop using the interactive electric panel with six learning stations; baby activity table is intended for infants ages 6 months to 3 years
Your baby will love pretending to talk on the phone, pressing the light-up piano keys, playing with the interactive book and more
Fun sound effects and light patterns reward your child’s curiosity and encourage discovery; thirteen playful sing-along songs and melodies add to the fun
The Learn and Discover Table introduces letters, numbers, shapes, colors, greetings and time concepts; bead track and roller develops fine motor skills; requires 2 AA batteries (included)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
